K-9.source: BC Math K-9 Classroom Assessment Resource Package

K-1: Ask simple math questions; show curiosity.
6-7: Pose complex problems in varied contexts.
8-9: Pose rich problems and lines of inquiry.

connecting_and_reflecting.description: Connect math ideas, other areas, First Peoples perspectives, and personal interests; reflect on thinking.

K-9: Connect math concepts with other math, other learning, and own interests.
Recognize and connect First Peoples perspectives where relevant.
Reflect on own and othersâ€™ mathematical thinking (increasing sophistication by grade).

reasoning_and_analyzing.description: Number/quantity sense, patterning, spatial reasoning, logical thinking.

K-3: Use reasoning to explore number, patterns, and comparisons.
4-5: Use fluent, flexible number thinking; explore patterns and spatial relationships.
6-7: Use logical reasoning, estimation, and pattern recognition to make decisions.
8-9: Use logical reasoning, estimation strategies, and pattern analysis in increasingly abstract situations.

understanding_and_solving.description: Use tools, representations, and strategies to solve problems.

K-3: Use concrete materials and simple strategies to explore and solve problems.
4-5: Use multiple strategies and visual models for contextual problems.
6-7: Apply multiple strategies and technologies to real-life and abstract problems.
8-9: Select efficient strategies, model with mathematics in diverse contexts.

communicating_and_representing.description: Use math language and representations to explain thinking.

K-3: Share math thinking with words, objects, and pictures.
4-5: Use appropriate vocabulary and multiple representations.
6-7: Explain and justify math ideas and decisions.
8-9: Communicate and justify solutions using precise mathematical language and forms.
